instruction: Find the most-cited paper that cites the paper 'Segment Anything' on Google Scholar. Stop at the screen showing the paper abstract.
future_tasks: Find at least three representative survey papers on LLM agents on Google Scholar, and add their titles to the Notes.
Find three detailed user reviews of the Bose QC45 headphones from Amazon. Summarize the general sentiment in the Notes.

I have some onions, beef, and potatoes in my refrigerator. Can you find me a Chinese-style recipe that uses all three ingredients and can be prepared in under an hour? And find me a video tutorial on YouTube for that. Stop at the screen displaying the video.

Can you check the MacDonald's APP to see if there are any Rewards or Deals including Spicy McCrispy. If so, help me add that to Mobile Order (Do not pay yet, I will do it myself). And then check the pickup location and get directions on Google Maps. Stop at the screen showing the route.

To find the most-cited paper that cites the "Segment Anything" paper on Google Scholar, I need to search for the paper on Google Scholar, access its citation list, and sort the citing papers by the number of citations. Then, I will select the most-cited paper and stop at its abstract. The Google Scholar website can be accessed via the Chrome browser.

1. Open the Chrome browser from the home screen.

3. Search for the "Segment Anything" paper on Google Scholar.
4. Access the list of papers that cite "Segment Anything."
5. Sort the citing papers by the number of citations.
6. Select the most-cited paper and stop at its abstract.

### Current Subgoal ###
Open the Chrome browser from the home screen.
